description: Modifies a cluster subnet group to include the specified list of VPC subnets. The operation replaces the existing list of subnets with the new list of subnets. VPC Block Public Access (BPA) enables you to block resources in VPCs and subnets that you own in a Region from reaching or being reached from the internet through internet gateways and egress-only internet gateways. If a subnet group for a provisioned cluster is in an account with VPC BPA turned on, the following capabilities are blocked: For more information about VPC BPA, see Block public access to VPCs and subnets in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

parameters.name: ClusterSubnetGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the subnet group to be modified.

parameters.name: SubnetIds
parameters.description: An array of VPC subnet IDs. A maximum of 20 subnets can be modified in a single request. (string) ---

nested_items.name: ClusterSubnetGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the cluster subnet group.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the cluster subnet group.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The VPC ID of the cluster subnet group.

nested_items.name: SubnetGroupStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the cluster subnet group. Possible values are Complete, Incomplete and Invalid.

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: A list of the VPC  Subnet elements.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the availability zone.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The list of tags for the cluster subnet group.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key, or name, for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: SupportedClusterIpAddressTypes
nested_items.description: The IP address types supported by this cluster subnet group. Possible values are ipv4 and dualstack.
